ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No indeed! Truly it is a reminder,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: No indeed; this is only a Reminder.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Not this way – this is the advice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nay; indeed it is an admonition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! surely it is an admonishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No indeed; it is a Reminder
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but verily it is an Admonishment,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By no means! Verily it is an admonition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No indeed! These [verses of the Quran ] are a reminder
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By no means (should it be so)! For it is indeed a Message of instruction:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay, (do not do like this), indeed it (these Verses of this Quran) are an admonition,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No indeed, this is a Reminder;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Do not. This is a Lesson.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: No! Indeed, these verses are a reminder;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [80:11] No indeed!, do not behave like this. Truly it, the sūra, is, or the verses [are], a reminder, an admonition for [all] creatures —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay) do not do this; He says: do not turn to those who think themselves independent of Allah and turn away from he who fears Allah. After this reminder, the Prophet (pbuh) used to honour Ibn Umm Maktum and treat him well, (but verily it) this surah (is an Admonishment) from Allah both for the rich and the poor,
